title: Sections 5 and 82 of the Solicitors Act 1954 and with the concurrence of the
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as The Solicitors Acts 1954 to 2015
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as The Solicitors Acts 1954 to 2015 

(Apprentices’ Fees) Regulations 2022.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited solicitor act 1954 2015 (apprentices fees) regulation 2022

title: Sections 5 and 82 of the Solicitors Act 1954 and with the concurrence of the
heading: 2. These Regulations shall come into operation on the 1st day of July 2022
text_raw:
2. These Regulations shall come into operation on the 1st day of July 2022 
and The Solicitors Acts, 1954 to 2008 (Apprentices’ Fees) Regulations, 2008 
(S.I. No. 577 of 2008) shall from that date stand revoked.
text_norm: 2 regulation shall come operation 1st day july 2022 solicitor act 1954 2008 (apprentices fees) regulation 2008 (s.i no 577 2008) shall date stand revoked

title: Sections 5 and 82 of the Solicitors Act 1954 and with the concurrence of the
heading: (a) The words and phrases in these Regulations and in the Schedule
text_raw:
3. 

(a) The words and phrases in these Regulations and in the Schedule 
hereto shall have the meanings respectively assigned by the 
Solicitors Acts 1954 to 2015 and, except insofar as may be 
inconsistent there-with, the provisions of the Solicitors Acts, 
1954 to 1994 (Apprenticeship and Education) Regulations, 2001 
(S.I. No. 546 of 2001) and the provisions of the Solicitors Acts, 
1954 to 2011 (Apprenticeship and Education) (Amendment) 
Regulations, 2019 (S.I. No. 503 of 2019). 

(b) The Interpretation Act 2005 shall apply for the purposes of the 
inter-pretation of these Regulations as it applies for the purposes 
of the interpretation of an Act of the Oireachtas, except insofar 
as it may be inconsistent with the provisions of the Solicitors 
Acts 1954 to 2015 or The Solicitors Acts, 1954 to 1994 
(Apprenticeship and Education) Regulations, 2001 (S.I. No. 546 
of 2001) or The Solicitors Acts, 1954 to 2011 (Apprenticeship 
and Education) Regulations, 2019 (S.I. No. 503 of 2019) or 
these Regulations.
text_norm: 3 (a) word phrase regulation schedule hereto shall meaning respectively assigned solicitor act 1954 2015 except insofar may inconsistent there-with provision solicitor act 1954 1994 (apprenticeship education) regulation 2001 (s.i no 546 2001) provision solicitor act 1954 2011 (apprenticeship education) (amendment) regulation 2019 (s.i no 503 2019) (b) interpretation act 2005 shall apply purpose inter-pretation regulation applies purpose interpretation act oireachtas except insofar may inconsistent provision solicitor act 1954 2015 solicitor act 1954 1994 (apprenticeship education) regulation 2001 (s.i no 546 2001) solicitor act 1954 2011 (apprenticeship education) regulation 2019 (s.i no 503 2019) regulation

title: Sections 5 and 82 of the Solicitors Act 1954 and with the concurrence of the
heading: 4. As and from the date on which these Regulations shall come into
text_raw:
4. As and from the date on which these Regulations shall come into 
operation, the fees specified in the Schedule hereto shall be paid to the Society 
in respect of courses and examinations provided for in The Solicitors Acts, 
1954 to 1994 (Apprenticeship and Education) Regulations, 2001 (S.I. No. 546 
of 2001) and The Solicitors Acts 1954 to 2011 (Apprenticeship and Education) 
(Amendment) regulations, 2019 (S.I. No. 503 of 2019). 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 3rd June, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 SCHEDULE 

within referred to

title: Sections 5 and 82 of the Solicitors Act 1954 and with the concurrence of the
heading: 8. For each day or part of a day re-attending the Professional Practice
text_raw:
8. For each day or part of a day re-attending the Professional Practice 

Course or the Professional Practice Course I or the Professional Practice Course 

II or an Advanced Elective, or for each day or part of a day attending the 

Professional Practice Course or the Professional Practice Course I or the 

Professional Practice Course II or an Advanced Elective by a barrister to whom 

Section 43 (as substituted by Section 51 of the Act of 1994) of the Act applies

heading: 18. Administration fee for applications to the Education Committee in respect of
text_raw:
18. Administration fee for applications to the Education Committee in respect of 

 secondment / transfer of indentures / assignment of indentures in circumstances 

 where the application is seeking retrospective consent 

€400 

€80 

€300 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [269] 5 

Signed on behalf of the Law Society of Ireland pursuant to 
Section 79 of the Solicitors Act 1954, 

26 May, 2022. 

MICHELLE NÍ LONGÁIN, 

President of the Law Society of Ireland. 

Pursuant to the provisions of Section 82 (2) (as amended by 
Section 25 (1) of the Solicitors (Amendment) Act 1960 and 
Section 66 of the Solicitors (Amendment) Act, 1994) of the 
Solicitors Act, 1954, I concur with the making of these 
Regulations, 

26 May, 2022. 

MS JUSTICE MARY IRVINE, 
President of the High Court.

title: Sections 5 and 82 of the Solicitors Act 1954 and with the concurrence of the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The principal purpose of the Instrument is to provide for increases in the fees 
payable to the Law Society of Ireland in respect of courses and examinations 
provided for in The Solicitors Acts, 1954 to 1994 (Apprenticeship and 
Education) Regulations, 2001 (S.I. No. 546 of 2001) and The Solicitors Acts, 
1954 to 2011 (Apprenticeship and Education) (Amendment) Regulations, 2019 
(S.I. No. 503 of 2019) operative from the 1st day of July 2022.
